prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: * Line 1: Starting point (0.0, 0.0), Ending point (0.75, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting point (0.75, 0.0), Ending point (0.75, 0.6872) * Line 3: Starting point (0.75, 0.6872), Ending point (0.0, 0.6872) * Line 4: Starting point (0.0, 0.6872), Ending point (0.0, 0.0) 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: * Euler angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 * Translation vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.1777. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a curved side. 1. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0154, 0.0184, 0.1777. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. 3. Create a rectangle by drawing four lines as follows: * Line 1: Starting point (0.0, 0.0), Ending point (0.7192, 0.0) * Line 2: Starting point (0.7192, 0.0), Ending point (0.7192, 0.6505) * Line 3: Starting point (0.7192, 0.6505), Ending point (0.0, 0.6505) * Line 4: Starting point (0.0, 0.6505), Ending point (0.0, 0.0) 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.7192. 5. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis to a depth of 0.154, but with an opposite normal direction. 6. Perform a cut operation with the current part and the previous part to create a curved side.</description>
